content: The patient is a female who sustained a right middle finger crush injury on July 8, 2025, when her finger was crushed by a dumbbell. She experienced immediate pain, swelling, and limited motion. She presented to urgent care where X-rays revealed a fracture. She was treated with a splint. Repeat X-rays taken four weeks later showed continued fracture. She has continued wearing the splint and is now presenting for evaluation and treatment. She reports some paresthesia at the distal phalanx.
title: HPI Spencer

content: Some hematoma noted excellent flexion of the PIP some DIP stiffness , no tenderness palpation of the distal phalanx , some paresthesia at the distal phalanx
title: Musculoskeletal

content: X-rays show a fracture of the distal phalanx with stable alignment and good fracture healing
title: Imaging Results

content: - Right middle finger distal phalanx fracture
title: Assessment

content: Continue splinting and avoid hanging from hands.
Return to clinic in 3 weeks for nail check before wedding.
title: Plan
